comparing_fragstats_landscapemetrics.Rmd

Known issues

  • FRAGSTATS only rounds after the 4th decimal place
  • That also effects the resolution, if your raster has a resolution with more than 4 decimal places the results for metrics that rely on that are wrong (e.g. AREA, xxx)

Possible errors in FRAGSTATS for certain metrics

CIRCLE metric

Patches with 1 cell get a CIRCLE metric of 0, should be something around 0.36 instead. Sometimes the abbreviation is CIRCLE, sometimes SQUARE.

PARA metric

There is a mixup between hectare and meter in documentation and code of FRAGSTATS. The program uses hectare, whereas the documentation states in the formula square meter.

SHAPE metric

The documentation of FRAGSTATS formulates the SHAPE metric on patch level as:

… and FRAGSTATS give as result for a patch with 5 cells and a perimeter of 12 the value of 1.200.

However, implementing the same formula in R results in:

(0.25 * 12) / sqrt(5)
## [1] 1.341641

Patch level

Class level

## Warning: Class 1: PAFRAC = NA for class with < 10 patches
## Warning: Class 3: PAFRAC = NA for class with < 10 patches
## Warning: Column `metric` joining factor and character vector, coercing into
## character vector

Landscape level

## Warning in .f(.x[[i]], ...): RPR = NA for classes_max=NULL
